bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: attempting to install desktop environments on top of gnome in Fedora 24 workstation fails with "package initial-setup-gui-0.3.40-1.fc24.x86_64 requires anaconda-gui >= 24.0, but none of the providers can be installed"
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.sudo dnf install @Mate-desktop 2.enter password and confirm installation 3.log out and attempt to log in and change to mate desktop
Actual results: immediately gnome-terminal spits out the following: Last metadata expiration check: 1:43:21 ago on Sun Jun 5 22:15:23 2016. Error: package initial-setup-gui-0.3.40-1.fc24.x86_64 requires anaconda-gui >= 24.0, but none of the providers can be installed (try to add '--allowerasing' to command line to replace conflicting packages)
Attempting to try again indicates mate desktop is already installed, however logging out and back in, there is no option to change to mate desktop.
Expected results: a load of mate applications and utilities should be installed and upon log on there should be the option to switch to mate desktop
Additional info: may be related to bugs 1340059 and 1339742 and 1337731.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1339742 ***
That bug 1339742 says it is fixed, but I still cannot install Mate-desktop in Fedora 24... What is the answer?

Tried again to install @mate-desktop from Fedora 24 Server with same failure. Then tried with the dnf suggested --allowerasing option. Still says mate-desktop is already installed. If nothing else, this is false and a bug in dnf because nothing from mate-desktop was installed. I then dnf remove @mate-desktop. dnf says no packages marked for removal... then start from scratch with dnf --allowerasing install @mate-desktop and now it works but with several packages marked for downgrade.
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.
